intro: Pedicularis brevilabris, commonly known as the short-lipped lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, which includes parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with two lips that are shorter than those of other Pedicularis species. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers and hairy stems, making it a distinctive member of its genus.
